communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A  copy of any contract, purchase order or agreement between VMI or any entity on behalf of VMI with eAdvancement to conduct the "19th annual VMI Employee Survey" or similar survey/questionnaire distributed on or about 12 Feb 2025 including any for or by any VMI Office, Jerold Pearson (https://eadvancement.org/team/jerold-pearson/), eAdvancement (https://eadvancement.org/about/) or VMI office(s) or other internal or outside organization(s) from 1 February to the date of this FOIA.  The procurement records requested are at a minimum and without limitation, the purchase order, contract, communications or other document(s) showing at least the statement of work, purpose and focus of the survey/questionnaire. If the contract or purchase information is available on eVA, VASCUPP or other online system please provide a link. If this was not purchased through eVA, VASCUPP, or other Commonwealth of Virginia procurement process, please provide the method of acquisition and the associated documents. 

This FOIA is not requesting responses to the questionaire/survey or any personally identifying information on the questionnaire respondent(s)

As the amount of these records are small, the survey/questionaire was recently developed and distributed, they should be readily available without any search costs and associated fees within the 5 day window of the FOIA. 

I am willing to accept partial and incremental responses to this request as the acquisition documents should all be readily available in the procurement file VMI is required to maintain in accordance with Virginia Procurement Rules and the Virginia Public Procurement Act.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Precinct boundaries in effect for the 2024 primary and general elections (Dallas County Board Of Registrars)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) a map of the precinct boundaries in effect for the 2024 primary and general elections, in geospatial format (shapefiles, geoJSON, etc.) Here is an example of what we are looking for from Elmore County, AL: https://www.arcgis.com/apps/mapviewer/index.html?webmap=07e6542a0cec475fb0ff61690c2d9787.

If a map for the 2024 elections is not available, we request 2) the most recent map of precinct boundaries that exists.

If a geospatial version is not available (for example, it is a physical map on the wall), we request 3) a high-resolution PDF or photo(s) that provide enough detail of the map to identify the exact precinct boundaries and recreate them in a geospatial format. Here is an example of what we are looking for from Etowah County, AL: https://etowahcounty.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2024/01/EtowahPrecincts-2023.pdf

If no map exists at all, we request 4) a copy of whatever is used to designate areas, and the voters living therein, to precincts (for example, metes and bounds of the exact boundaries, a street address file, etc.).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Andrew Drechsler.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A  copy of any surveys and/or questionaire sent to VMI employees from or on behalf of any VMI Office, Jerold Pearson )https://eadvancement.org/team/jerold-pearson/), eAdvancement (https://eadvancement.org/about/) or the VMI office(s) or other internal or outside organization(s) from 1 February to the date of this FOIA. This particularly includes the "19th annual VMI Emploee Survey" or similar survey/questionaire distributed on or about 12 Feb 2025, eAdvancement Consulting or any other survey/questionaire. 

This FOIA is not requesting responses to the questionaire/survey or any personally identifying information on respondent just the survey itself, any messages/ instructions sent to employees concerning the survey/questionaire.

As the amount of these records are small, the survey/questionaire was recently developed and distributed, they should be readily available without any extensive or costly search and associated fees within the 5 day window of the FOIA. 

I am willing to accept partial and incremental responses to this request and so expect that the survey/questionaire and associated email(s) to employees sent within the last few days should be immediately available and can be immediately.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Salary Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

For each employee employed by the Durham in the specific time frame below:

1. First and Middle and Last name (Middle initial is fine)

2. Job Title/Occupation/Position

3. Gender

4. Race

5. Year of birth

6. Date of appointment

7. Last day of work, if applicable

8. Annual Salary from 2001 to today or Annual Hourly Rate from 2001 to most recent date that data is collected

9. Total Annual Compensation from 2001 to most recent date that data is collected

10. Department (Police, Legal, DCSD, etc)

We request the information be furnished in the electronic format in which it is maintained, not in PDF or paper printouts. If the information is maintained in custom electronic format not currently available to the public, we request the information be furnished in an electronic format that is viewable by standard software, such as Excel, Access, SPSS, SQL, etc. Please provide the data through a file sharing service like Drop Box.

Because we seek the information in order to disseminate it to the public, and because the information regards the safety, welfare, and legal rights of the general public, the request meets the statutory definition of in the public interest. This request is not for commercial benefit because this request is made by a research lab whose principal purpose is to access and disseminate publicly available information regarding the general public's safety, welfare, and legal rights.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests
